alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 5:06PM MST until August 14 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 815 PM MST. * At 504 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in extreme northwest Navajo and northeast Coconino counties including Shonto north to the Utah state line. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Inscription House Landing Strip, Navajo National Monument, Cow Springs, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Shonto. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 347 and 359. State Route 564 between mile markers 382 and 383. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Navajo Creek, Shonto Wash, Nokai Creek, Begashibito Wash, West Canyon Creek, Kaibito Creek, Last End Wash and Last Chance Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
